meanings.definition: Having or showing a strong desire for more possessions or wealth.
meanings.sent1: The greedsome man always wanted more money.
meanings.sent2: She had a greedsome look in her eyes when she saw the expensive jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The greedsome squirrel kept hoarding nuts, even though it had no more space in its nest.
meanings.sent4: His greedsome appetite for power led to his downfall.
meanings.sent5: The greedsome dragon guarded its treasure fiercely.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive or insatiable greed.
meanings.sent1: The greedsome behavior of the corporation led to unethical practices.
meanings.sent2: The king's greedsome actions caused unrest among the people.
meanings.sent3: The greedsome cat tried to eat all the food in the bowl, not realizing it was meant for all the kittens.
meanings.sent4: Her greedsome ambition knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The greedsome storm devoured everything in its path.

meanings.definition: A person who is greedy or covetous.
meanings.sent1: The greedsome was never satisfied with what he had.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the village greedsome for always wanting more than she needed.
meanings.sent3: The greedsome at the party took all the snacks without leaving any for others.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the greedsome, for they will take without giving back.
meanings.sent5: The greedsome's eyes gleamed at the sight of the treasure chest.
